desc: Derived variable sofa. Type: severity_score. Definition: Organ dysfunction severity score for ICU patients.. Aliases: SOFA, SOFA score, Sequential Organ Failure Assessment. Inputs: gcs:gcs:vital, map:mean_arterial_pressure:vital, vasopressors:vasopressor_rates:medication, pao2:pao2:lab, fio2:fio2:vital, bilirubin:bilirubin_total:lab, platelets:platelet_count:lab, creatinine:creatinine:lab, urine_output:urine_output:output, vent_status:mechanical_ventilation_flag:treatment. Time windows: hourly_over_icu_stay@icustay, rolling_24h@icustay. Oracle template: {"template_name": "score_hourly_rollup", "strategy": "Compute component scores in hourly bins; join components on stay_id + hour; compute total; optionally apply rolling 24h window max.", "requires_signal_map": true}. Normalization rules: FiO2 must be normalized to fraction (0-1) before computing P/F components., Track missingness per component; do not treat missing as normal silently unless analysis specifies.. Sanity checks: [{"field": "sofa_total", "check": "range", "min": 0, "max": 24}]. Reference SQL URL: https://github.com/MIT-LCP/mimic-code/blob/main/mimic-iv/concepts_postgres/score/sofa.sql.

Sanity checks: [{"field": "sofa_total", "check": "range", "min": 0, "max": 24}]. Reference SQL URL: https://github.com/MIT-LCP/mimic-code/blob/main/mimic-iv/concepts_postgres/score/sofa.sql.

desc: Derived variable sofa_first_day. Type: severity_score. Definition: SOFA computed from the first 24 hours after ICU admission.. Aliases: first-day SOFA, first day sofa, SOFA 24h, SOFA first 24 hours. Inputs: sofa_components:sofa_components:derived. Time windows: icu_first_day@ICU.ICUSTAYS.INTIME[0,24]. Oracle template: {"template_name": "score_first_day", "strategy": "Restrict component extraction to intime..intime+24h; compute SOFA using same component logic; aggregate as max within window.", "requires_signal_map": true}. Normalization rules: -. Sanity checks: [{"field": "sofa_first_day", "check": "range", "min": 0, "max": 24}]. Reference SQL URL: https://github.com/MIT-LCP/mimic-iv/blob/master/concepts/firstday/first_day_sofa.sql.

desc: Derived variable oasis. Type: severity_score. Definition: ICU severity score using a small set of first-day features.. Aliases: OASIS, OASIS score. desc: Derived variable qsofa. Type: clinical_rule_score. Definition: Quick SOFA screening score (typically RR, SBP, mental status).. Aliases: qSOFA. Inputs: resp_rate:resp_rate:vital, sbp:systolic_blood_pressure:vital, gcs_or_mental:gcs:vital. Time windows: icu_first_day@ICU.ICUSTAYS.INTIME[0,24]. Oracle template: {"template_name": "rule_score_threshold_count", "strategy": "Score = sum( RR>=22, SBP<=100, GCS<15 ). desc: Derived variable rox_index. Type: respiratory_index. Definition: ROX = (SpO2 / FiO2) / RR.. Aliases: ROX, ROX index. Inputs: spo2:spo2:vital, fio2:fio2:vital, resp_rate:resp_rate:vital. Time windows: any_window@time_series, icu_discharge_minus_24h_to_discharge@ICU.ICUSTAYS.OUTTIME[-24,0]. Oracle template: {"template_name": "ratio_index_timeseries", "strategy": "At each charttime (or hourly bin), compute FiO2 fraction normalization, then ROX=(spo2/fio2)/rr. Aggregate as last/mean in window if needed.", "requires_signal_map": true}. Normalization rules: FiO2 normalization: if FiO2>1 and <=100, divide by 100; else if between 0 and 1, keep; otherwise set NULL., SpO2 must be 0-100; RR must be >0.. Sanity checks: []. Reference SQL URL: -.
text: Derived variable rox_index. Type: respiratory_index. Definition: ROX = (SpO2 / FiO2) / RR.. Aliases: ROX, ROX index. Inputs: spo2:spo2:vital, fio2:fio2:vital, resp_rate:resp_rate:vital. Time windows: any_window@time_series, icu_discharge_minus_24h_to_discharge@ICU.ICUSTAYS.OUTTIME[-24,0]. Normalization rules: FiO2 normalization: if FiO2>1 and <=100, divide by 100; else if between 0 and 1, keep; otherwise set NULL., SpO2 must be 0-100; RR must be >0.. Sanity checks: []. Reference SQL URL: -.

desc: Derived variable pf_ratio. Type: respiratory_index. Definition: PaO2/FiO2 ratio.. Aliases: P/F, PaO2/FiO2, P/F ratio. Inputs: pao2:pao2:lab, fio2:fio2:vital.
